lines.text:
[Via subtitles, to the House of Lords]
A king made me a clown! A queen made me a Peer! But first, God made me a man!
I came back to find my little son. What have you done with him?
By our grace he is still alive, and quite well, I believe. A Comprachico surgeon carved a grin upon his face so he might laugh forever at his fool of a father.
Who disturbs the rest of Ursus the philosopher?
My name is Gwynplaine and I am cold and hungry.

[while getting Gwynplaine some food, Gwynplaine takes the baby out of his coat and puts her on the table, turning around]
What, are there TWO of you?
Stop laughing! Stop laughing I say!
God closed my eyes so I could see only the real Gwynplaine.
What a lucky clown you are! You don't have to wipe off your laugh.
A woman has seen my face and yet may love me.
The proud rebel who refused to kiss our hand returns to kiss the iron lady!
